availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Coburn D. Outten (Mason County, Kentucky, tinner & commissary sgt 10th KY Cav, pvt & 2nd lieut 45 KY Mtd Inf USA)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, apprentice tinner and soldier. Kentucky native. Apprentice tinner in Maysville in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as commissary sergeant from September 9, 1862, to September 17, 1863. Served in the 45th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and second lieutenant from February 6, 1864, to February 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 350.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 256.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 453.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0438.
Special Schedules of the Eleventh Census (1890) Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Union Veterans of the Civil War, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series M123, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 8 /17 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Coburn Dewees Outten, Sr (1843-1898)," Memorial #36734971, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36734971 (accessed July 6, 2020).
